glsa.title: imlib2: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: imlib2 contains several vulnerabilities that could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

background.p: imlib2 is an advanced replacement for image manipulation libraries such as libXpm. It is utilized by numerous programs, including gkrellm and several window managers, to display images.

description.p: M. Joonas Pihlaja discovered several buffer overflows in loader_argb.c, loader_png.c, loader_lbm.c, loader_jpeg.c, loader_tiff.c, loader_tga.c, loader_pnm.c and an out-of-bounds memory read access in loader_tga.c.

impact.p: An attacker can entice a user to process a specially crafted JPG, ARGB, PNG, LBM, PNM, TIFF, or TGA image with an "imlib2*" binary or another application using the imlib2 libraries. Successful exploitation of the buffer overflows causes the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
